channel.title: [317] ChaosScape Development Team
channel.description:
[size=18pt]We are now accepting applications again![/size] [ul][list] [size=18pt][b]ALL staff are required to know/have how to use the following:[/b][/size] [size=24pt][list][li]MUST HAVE A MICROPHONE THAT WORKS[/li][/list] [list][li]How to use a FTP program[/li] [li]Understanding of basic HTML and CSS[/li] [li]Knowing how to use Ventrilo and Teamspeak[/li] [li]Must not be a RuneScape player or be willing to sacrifice a number of hours to commit.[/li] [li]Must be techy (can't really define strict rule but having understanding of computers is a plus)[/li] [li]Have MSN[/li] [li]Is over the age of 15 and 6 months[/li] [li]Know how to use MySQL connection utilities[/li] [li]Don't act like 12 yr olds[/li] [/list] [size=24pt]If you don't meet the above conditions and requirements don't bother applying, you're useless to our team.[/size] [center][img]http://chaosscape.net/images/media/development.png[/img] [/center] [img]http://chaosscape.net/images/media/advert.png[/img] ===============What's currently being worked on=============== To avoid leaking I am going to be releasing the first distribution under my name. This is because I don't want to be in a position where my code gets stolen and released under someone else's identity. But at the moment I am just packaging and documenting the code, I've added some voids that were missing, which are commonly used in other sources but got removed. I hope this will make developing with this source a little bit easier and less painful for the new beginners. For more confident coders, this isn't a big update. [color=navy][b]Website Department:[/b] With the site source there were some changes that had been made to php since 2007 which caused the site to play up and load a white page. I've patched every page up, fixed an exploit in the player inbox centre and currently working on new a clone version of the knowledge base guide but modifying it so site owners will be able to add additional pages to the site without creating a new .php page. In the future I hope to create a admin panel which will allow site admins to edit/add/delete pages without having to go through phpmyadmin. So far: [list] [li]Implanted FaceBook into the site which allows users to post comments and 'Like' using their FaceBook account. [/li] [li]Working on the admin control panel. We spent about 20 hours in the last day trying to make a page that allowed the news to be posted from a web page rather than having to go through phpmyadmin. Unfortunately, we had the script right but it wouldn't work and we eventually realized that the table started with a '[' which caused the script to fail. So we had to rename our tables and change the site to be able to read from the database. *sigh* But we got there in the end. [/li] [li]Fixed up some code that wasn't working the way it should of across the site.[/li] [li] Fixed the download page [/li] [li] Added a footer but for some reason it screws up the whole site in IE explorer so we got rid of it for the front page until I can be bothered to fix it. It's not really a major concern right now to have this feature.[/li] [li] Updated the staff list in the knowledge base and will be adding kind of like a 'About me' section for each staff member which allows people to read up on the staff. - you know, just incase you wanted to become obsessed with us and stalk us on twitter and FaceBook.[/li] [li] Added a twitter site (clone) ;) which is aimed at inviting it's users to use it for private server development.[/li] [li] Created a proper design layout for the aforementioned site above.[/li] [li] Updated the logo to something that looks more authentic.[/li] [li] Added the FaceBook 'Like' function to the knowledge base. But I removed it because it caused some alignment errors but I will re add it soon.[/li] [li] Built a server status page. This allows users to advertise their private servers pretty much a status checker just like Mopar's but we encourage it only to be used by people who are running ChaosScape. But we have no way to moderate this so DAMMNNN. :([/li] [li] Working on the admin site and trying to theme it with a descent design. At the moment it's just a boring white page with a form. >.>[/li][/list] [size=12pt][b]23rd July 2010[/b][/size] [list][li] Fixed site exploits.[/li] [li]Added basic functions to the admin CP.[/li] [/list] [size=12pt][b]25th July 2010[/b][/size] [list][li]Added a edit post function to the forums[/li] [li]Added fishing[/li] [li]Added and fixed combat. Pretty much have the timers and spec finished thanks to Silva[/li] [li]Began construction on the GE.[/li] [li]Began improving on the site and adding features[/li] [li]Carter (EwfsPrince) & Ben began working on the new site CMS template that will replace the current site.[/li] [li]Mod Jmood, HashMap to hold connections and keep Syipkerpker out.[/li] [li]Mod Pat: Updated PacketParser.java, Fishing.java, and PacketNpc.java to Complete fishing skill[/li] [/list] [size=12pt][b]29th July 2010[/b][/size] [list][li]Almost finished converting to the new site.[/li] [li]Added full firemaking[/li] [li]Working on the GE site[/li] [li]Fixing login erros where it couldn't locate the tables[/li] [li]Added MD5 encryption for login[/li] [li]Added the processor and RAM on the server for the launch.[/li] [li]Sioli is optimizing the code to speed up the server responses and hopefully increase performance by 20%[/li] [/list] [list] [li]Fixed last post user. it now really shows the last post not the first one[/li] [li]Added times to posts on forum[/li] [li]added last post time in categorie veiw[/li] [li]added defualt timezone it is now Australia/Adelaide (GMT +9:30)[/li] [li]Change all meta refershes so increase loading speed[/li] [li]Change Last edted to include data and time[/li] [li]added time comment to footer[/li][/list] [size=12pt][b]01 Aug 2010[/b][/size] [list][li]Added Last edit time and user to topic posts[/li] [li]Added Last edit time and user to comment posts[/li] [li]Fixed Titles on all pages and added Slogan[/li] [li]Fixed artical of the week link[/li][/list] [size=12pt][b]03 Aug 2010[/b][/size] [list][li]Started recoding functions in functions.php[/li] [li]Added functions_.php for custom functions[/li] [li]Changed all config includes to require_once[/li] [li]Add quick functions to get the following[/li] [li]--positionx[/li] [li]--positiony[/li] [li]--email[/li] [li]--rights server[/li] [li]--rights web[/li] [li]--skill level[/li] [li]--skill xp[/li] [li]-Added MySQL quick functions[/li] [li]-Added Class to handel all custom functions[/li][/list] [size=12pt][b]08 Aug 2010[/b][/size] [list][li]Added Disable page function.[/li][/list] [size=12pt][b]9th August 2010[/b][/size] [list][li]Added a site user bar to the site[/li] [li]Jmood messed up the server real bad but hes fixing it.[/li] [li]Working on the GE site...still[/li] [li]Added a new background[/li] [li]Added a move topic function to the forum[/li] [li]Pat started developing agility[/li] [li]Fixed the no clipping issue[/li] [li]Fixed some of the site images that were still displaying as "RuneScape"[/li] [li]Started work on the chatroom feature which is MySQL backended with the db[/li] [li]Started work on the private message feature[/li] [li]Added the RuneTube feature[/li] [li]Added the MySQL highscores module[/li] [li]Fixed some broken links that were found around the site[/li] [li]Fixed the spawning issue with newly created websites - fixed it by adding default coords in the db if nothing else gets defined in the signup script (fail safe)[/li] [/list] [size=12pt][b]20th August 2010[/b][/size] [list][li]Added the report user system[/li] [li]Fixed glitched with highscores.[/li] [li]Fixed up pretty much all of the skills[/li] [li]Fixed healing[/li] [li]Fixed import edits - got rid of any that we didn't need.[/li] [li]Fixed flaws in the LoginAuth[/li] [li]Fixed melee[/li] [li]Added multiple methods that were missing (typically these should of been in the source) [/li] [li]Fixed up NPC.Java[/li] [li]Fixed up Thieving which had major issues[/li] [li]Announced the official beta opening to be on 21st August 2010.[/li] [/list] [s] [size=12pt][b]5th September 2010[/b][/size] [list][li]Still working on the server source. Development a little bit slow due to EwfsPrince's commitments to end of year assignments an exams.[/li][/list] [size=12pt][b]14th September 2010[/b][/size] [list][li]Still working on the server source. I have exams and the team pretty much abandoned me but I'm still working on the source. I just fixed some very minor bugs in the source, can't do anything major til November.[/size] [size=12pt][b]4th - 13th October 2010[/b][/size] [list][li]Still lots of homework - nearly done though. I'm working on a great chatroom feature in my limited of free time for ChaosScape, it's in php but offers a variety of IRC type functions.[/size] [size=12pt][b]31st October 2010[/b][/size] I've returned, graduated from school (woo!) but I've still got a few assignments to hand up but nothing too drastic. I'm working on some new private server related stuff at the moment. I'll be updating the site more as I go. [b]Lead Developer/Owners[/b] Mod Carter Mod Justo [b]Client Developer[/b] Mod Siver [b]Java Coders[/b] Jmood [b]Website Development[/b] Mod Carter Mod Sioli Mod Justo [b]Moderator Team[/b] Mod Damien Mod Aron [/tt][/center] [b]Introduction:[/b] Hi guys, Before I go into depth about the development team and products I want to tell you a little about myself, I hope that this about me section will help make up your mind if this is a worthwhile project to take part in and if you think I’m the sort of person who would make good use of your time. Hi, I'm EwfsPrince (my alias) I’m 18 years old from South Australia and currently finishing high school. My biggest specialty is web design and coding, which I’ve been doing ever since I was 10 years old. I also code Java but I admit I’m not as fluent as I would like to be in the language, however there are some coding similarities between Java and PHP for example which have made learning a lot simpler and I am usually able to overcome any problems with my Java work – even though sometimes they may take a bit longer than the typical fluent coder. I am recruiting a team of dedicated people to help assist in the development of ChaosScape and in addition also in the development of our server related products that will be released under GPL licensing to the public. All members of the development team will be rewarded for their contributions, one way we reward everyone is by giving them free Unlimited hosting + cPanel (subject to fair use policy) which is provided by the web hosting enterprise that I run and manage. We want our team to be successful, which is why we are spending a lot of time creating tools and privately owned websites to help create a friendly working environment. We consider ourselves a different breed of development team and we do require very mature team, we prefer to recruit people who are over the age of 16 but we are willing to make exceptions if maturity is shown in the application process. [b]Our goal[/b] Our goal is to change the way we develop private servers. Not in the types of servers we code, not whether we code 317's or 600+'s but the way we think about developing our servers. For too long as MoparScapians have been held back in our progress by leechers and over time our more confident coders have left the community because of them and the fact that the RSPS's aren't moving forward quickly enough. [b]What do I mean by moving forward?[/b] All of our servers are underdeveloped, there isn't a server out there that isn't and it's because of a number of reasons which most of you would probably be able to work out but one of them is that we don't collaborate our work, we mainly post them on a forum and be done with it. It is proven when we share and talk about these things we learn differently to how we would just by reading, we soak up new information that we didn't understand before. There's more I want to say, but I won't waste any more of your time on this point. So, ChaosScape is more than a server project and I'm just going to give you a brief feature list of what is going to be released: [list] [li]A 317 standard source[/li] [li]A 317 MySQL server version source[/li] [li]A fully functional RuneScape site with PHP + MySQL with intergration with the MySQL server.[/li] [/list] [b]But it doesn't stop there![/b] We will also be creating tutorials, reference guides specific for our server source which will in effect teach you how to develop with our source code which will make it an ideal base for your next project. All of the code is open, none of it is anti-leech. [b][i]Won't this project source just get leeched?[/i][/b] All of our work will be continuously worked on, this means that leechers will have NO chance to compete with us. In my theory leeched servers only occur when a development team stops working on their source, and then posts it and 2 months later (once everyone forgotten about it) it gets posted under a different name. This source is more like a package and once it's been released it's structure and identity will not be mistaken for anything else and the average user will be able to tell how much the source has been modified. EASY! We have most of the site and both 317 server sources almost built, they just need a few more patches than I will release the first distribution to the public. Once it has been released the development team will be able to develop on it and make changes which will be released in the next version and so forth. Some of you might be wondering why I was discussing about collaborating work, at the moment it won't make entirely sense to you but in the release of the first version it will become clear. :P Now, enough talking lets start the application process. [size=14pt]We are now only accepting applications from 16 year olds and over!!![/size] [b]Name:[/b] [b]Age:[/b] [b]Country of residence:[/b] [b]Email:[/b] (you may choose to PM me this information if you desire) [b]MSN:[/b] (you may choose to PM me this information if you desire) [b]Applying for:[/b] (choose) Web Designer Graphics Designer Java Coder In-game Moderator (no more positions available) Ventrilo/Teamspeak (no more positions available) Site Moderator (no more positions available) Article Writer (no more positions available) Content Manager (no more positions available) Debugger & Beta Tester (no more positions available) Customer Support (no more positions available) [size=12pt] We currently do not have any positions available.
[b]How many hours a week do you spend online?[/b] 1-3 Hours 3-10 Hours 10-24 Hours 24-50 Hours 50 Hours + What previous experience have you had previously in the desired position(s)? [b]What projects online (Private servers, websites, IRC etc) have you been involved with?[/b] [b]Why do you think we should choose you?[/b] [b]How can you personally make a positive impact on the development team?[/b] [i]By typing 'Yes' below you agree that you are submitting your true contact details and that you are submitting this form for yourself and only for yourself and not on the behalf of anyone else. You agree that we may keep a copy of your application and keep it in the case that you decided to apply again and or if we decide to recruit you to a development team. You may decide to terminate your application by sending your name, e-mail address in a private message to EwfsPrince. This will cause any proceedings with your application to no longer continue and we will not contact you for future recruitment's until you apply again, however we will keep your application in our records for however long we seem fit. At any one time your application will not be viewable to the public and your details will not be sold or passed onto 3rd parties or anyone without your consent. In a case of a legal dispute between two parties or within the law of any country this information will be surrounded accordingly. You also agree that you are submitting your correct current age.[/i] (Say Yes under here)
The above privacy policy is just to protect my butt since I'm could potentially be gathering information from minors as young as 10? (children lie about their age all the time). Thanks for reading! [b]Now here is proof of current development. :)[/b] [img]http://www.ChaosScape.net/preview/91.png[/img] [img]http://www.ChaosScape.net/preview/92.png[/img] [img]http://www.ChaosScape.net/preview/93.png[/img] [size=14pt]Since then we have re-designed the entire website with a fresh look![/size] [img]http://www.ChaosScape.net/preview/newsite.png[/img] [img]http://www.ChaosScape.net/preview/newforum.png[/img] [img]http://www.ChaosScape.net/preview/newforum01.png[/img] In the images I am using a database from 2007/2008 I stopped developing on this source code but I decided to pick it up again. Hope that clears things up. :) [img]http://www.ChaosScape.net/preview/proof.png[/img] (my proof of being allowed to advertise URL and TeamSpeak server) [/list][/list][/list][/ul]

item.title: [317] ChaosScape Development Team
item.dc:creator: @Priv_Serv_Man Priv Serv Man
item.description:
@Priv_Serv_Man wrote:

[quote=“xxx123xxx, post:151, topic:348243”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=444626.msg3431189#msg3431189 date=1292366664]
He quit, as the project went nowhere.
[/quote]
No, he did not quit, all of the development team quit on him except for me. Me and him had the same dilemma which was the stupid exams. I don’t know if i will continue this project but I’m leaning towards yes.[/quote]

I am amazed to see this project still alive, I assumed it was hopeless when everyone starting quitting, then school started back for me and it went downhill from there. I truely missed working on chaoscape, it was the most successful project I’d worked on and I hated to see it go. Maybe it would be possible to start it back up?

Read full topic

item.title: [317] ChaosScape Development Team
item.dc:creator: @EwfsPrince EwfsPrince
item.description:
@EwfsPrince wrote:

It’s not MyNetBook and I have a shrewed idea how you might of come across it if it is.
I did however use MyNetBook to test it out about a year ago but I cleared the site now and it just has an empty wordpress installation on it.

I’m currently patching up the network so that if I choose to start a ‘general’ social network I could do it with the same database but isolate the two networks so that you can see each other but your not effected by getting notifications specifically from the one network. So you won’t see RuneScape news etc on the home page of the general network site.
You can’t register yet, although registration is open on the site I’m still fixing up a few things such as the URL trailing because some modules wont work.

Since you helped me out the other day with that major security hole on my site I will be sending you an invite to the network about 7 days before it get’s linked anywhere.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] ChaosScape Development Team
item.dc:creator: @EwfsPrince EwfsPrince
item.description:
@EwfsPrince wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:137, topic:348243”][quote author=EwfsPrince link=topic=444626.msg3386545#msg3386545 date=1288502767]

Development will continue as i got into break and Carter comes starts his summer break.

I finish school in 1 week and a half to 2 weeks time depending on how quickly I finish everything. I might be taking a week off after that just to re-coop myself from school. I’m actually really excited to return to working on ChaosScape but school comes first but for any who care, I’m doing really well in all of my subjects so there hasn’t been any slacking off on my behalf.
I do have several big plans for the RuneScape / Private server community and they are all pretty much original ideas I won’t give away anything but it’s not gonna be a /12yr old voice “an ultimate pking server” actually it has nothing to do with private servers really.

Edit:

I’m back :))))))))
Got a few assignments left to hand up for one subject but nothing too drastic really. But I’m working on new features for ChaosScape, not server wise but some nifty little features and additions that I think everyone even the critics will love.
[/quote]

hey whats going on w the website?? Its almost empty :([/quote]

I’m working on a few new projects for the site. I haven’t linked them in the nav menu yet but the word from the dev team is that a social network is being developed and is almost ready.

Read full topic
